definition: to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline

sentences.english: The bloom is set to wilt late Saturday or Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 花将会在星期六晚些时候或星期天凋谢。

sentences.english: Bamboo fence that lines the dying rose, hurt people 's heart.
sentences.chinese: 竹篱笆旁那株即将凋谢的玫瑰，刺痛了路人的心。

sentences.english: Grass will wither and flowers will fall . But the Word of the Lord will remain forever.
sentences.chinese: 草必枯干，花必凋谢，惟有主的道是永存的。

sentences.english: Empress Dowager of the palace and gardens from the withers not a dewy rose.
sentences.chinese: 皇太后的花园及行宫是从不曾凋谢的一支带露玫瑰。

sentences.english: This gust wind be pared off, our a lot of people possibility will fade.
sentences.chinese: 这阵风刮来，我们好多人可能就会凋谢。

sentences.english: Flowers will fade, grass will wither, but love endures.
sentences.chinese: 花会凋谢，草会干黄，惟有爱是永不衰残。

sentences.english: Life will never be the flower withers.
The Master said, "Only when the year turns freezing cold do we realize that pines and cypresses are the last to wither."
sentences.chinese: 孔子说，“岁月遇严寒，才知道松柏是最后凋谢的。”

sentences.english: The flowers failed for lack of sunshine.
The flowers failed for lack of rain.
sentences.chinese: 由于缺少雨水，花凋谢了。

sentences.english: The only amaranthine flower on earth is virtue.
sentences.chinese: 美德是世上唯一不凋谢的花朵。

sentences.english: This ivy was green at a time when other ivies had pooped out.
sentences.chinese: 这棵常春藤在其他常春藤都已凋谢时却仍然是绿的。

sentences.english: The flowers have faded, you should have watered them in time.
sentences.chinese: 花已经凋谢了，你应该及时浇水。

sentences.english: And love the sorrows of your changing face.
sentences.chinese: 爱你日益凋谢的脸上的哀戚。

sentences.english: The night opens the flowers in abstruse and acquiesces the day to get acknowledgment.
sentences.chinese: 夜机密地把花凋谢了，却让文日去领蒙谢词。

definition: to wither (and drop off)/to wilt/to pass away
(of a plant) to be in bud
Dutchman's pipe cactus, aka Queen of the Night cactus (Epiphyllum oxypetalum)
style of folk song popular in Gansu, Qinghai and Ningxia/CL:首[shou3]
